content: This PR is adding a second version of the Hahn-Banach theorem. Both versions are rather distinct and it probably doesn't make sense to have them in a single file. How should the two files be named? The current one is analysis.normed_space.hahn_banach.
cc @Yury G. Kudryashov, @Heather Macbeth given that've written the original file

I've just opened

  • #11458 (+91, -5): Lemmas about thickenings and convexity
  • #11486 (+182, -29): More lemmas about pointwise scalar multiplication of sets
  • #11487 (+395, -102 once #11486 has gone through): The norm as a seminorm, lemmas about balanced/absorbs/absorbent/star_convex.
It would be great to see this moving forward because I'm giving a talk on Krein-Milman (#8112) on the 5th of March!

Back at this again and once more, this morning I opened yet another bunch of PRs, meaning that the path to #7288 is now:

  • #13369 (+416, -306) provides covariant/contravariant instances and lemmas for with_bot/with_top
  • #13371 (+21, -6) specializes them to ennreal. Depends on #13369
  • #13379 (+114, -6) proves that two balls are disjoint iff the sum of their radii is less than the distance between their centers
  • #13380 (+122, -8) proves that thickening a thickening yields another thickening. Depends on #13371 and #13379
  • #13381 proves that adding two balls pointwise yields another ball. Depends on #13380
  • #11458 proves that you can thicken two disjoint compact sets while keeping them disjoint. Depends on #13381
@Kalle Kytölä, as promised :point_of_information:
This is actually ready, like for real!
